content: Hello there Sean, thank you for this beautiful article man. It’s both invaluably inspirational and intelligent. My name is William and I’m 21 years old; currently studying as an interior designer all the way in South Africa, and I’ve managed to land myself an internship in one of the biggest (if not the biggest) interior design businesses in my local town and I, unsurprisingly, enjoy every moment I spend at the office as it is an environment I’ve always dreamt of working in but now I have a problem. I was asked to create a website, which I did ever so well, for the business and it was the first time I’ve ever had to do something so creative and exciting for anyone — let alone myself before! And, inevitably, I’ve gained an extensive comprehension and a few more skills along the journey and now I’m caught up between a ‘website or interior design space’. I feel overwhelmed by the doors of opportunities that have opened up so wide for me and I simply do not know what to think anymore. I find it difficult to focus on two things at once because the more I concentrate on Web designing and development (which I’m commended for) I get less time to focus on my own studies (which I’m passionate about). You mentioned that ‘as a designer you need to keep learning as much as you possibly can to stay relevant, now I know you’re probably not some sort of designer life coach but I would really like to know how I can go about conquering the challenge that I’m currently faced with in your perspective?
